title: Spartaco Landini
text:
Spartaco Landini (; 31 January 1944 – 16 April 2017) was an <a href="Italians">Italian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> and later a manager.
Club career.
During his club career, Landini played for <a href="F.C.%20Internazionale%20Milano">F.C. Internazionale Milano</a>, <a href="U.S.%20Citt%C3%A0%20di%20Palermo">U.S. Città di Palermo</a> and <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">S.S.C. Napoli</a> in <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a>.
International career.
Landini earned 4 caps for the <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italy national football team</a> in 1966, and participated in the <a href="1966%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1966 FIFA World Cup</a>.
After retirement.
After he retired from playing football, Landini became one of <a href="Genoa%20C.F.C.">Genoa C.F.C.</a>'s directors.
Personal life.
Spartaco's brother, <a href="Fausto%20Landini">Fausto Landini</a>, also played football professionally, as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Spartaco Landini died in Genova on 16 April 2017 at the age of 73.
